title: help.nextcloud Email Address/Username enumeration

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

We're considering this a non-issue at the moment because we don't consider usernames/email addresses a secret.

We'd like to encourage to keep hacking. We're looking forward to your next report!
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

We're considering this a non-issue at the moment because we don't consider usernames/email addresses a secret.

We'd like to encourage to keep hacking. We're looking forward to your next report!

activities.message: Hi @blizzz , Thanks for the quick response.. but username and or email address are sensitive information that attackers can use in any malicious intention.. when you say you don't consider usernames/email address a secret , it means no fix will apply and therefore attacker can use this process to perform an attack.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @blizzz , Thanks for the quick response.. but username and or email address are sensitive information that attackers can use in any malicious intention.. when you say you don't consider usernames/email address a secret , it means no fix will apply and therefore attacker can use this process to perform an attack.

activities.message:
Also under the forgot password feature , if you see attached screen shot (forgot_password.JPG) , the site directly confirms the existence of an account.. the message display says "We have found an account matches  xxx@gmail.com / username " , with that message, the sites directly disclose a sensitive information such as username/email.

How this can be useful to attackers ? , below is a simple scenario:

If the users email address has been compromised , the attacker can try to reset the password in  https://help.nextcloud.com/ , with the display message.. the attacker can check and reset password link on the email and can directly change the password, meaning the account successfully compromised. This is only the basic scenario , but still there is a lot of ways that the attacker can use the sensitive information (email/username).

I think the sample above enough to convince you that this is a valid security issue.

Hoping for your response.

Regards
Japz
activities.markdown_message:

I think the sample above enough to convince you that this is a valid security issue.

Regards
Japz

activities.message:
I see this report #145396 which is also information disclosure issue, but on that report (#145396) , the issue is enumeration of subscribed/unsubscribed users and it is a valid security issue.. then on my report , it is enumeration not only of subscribe users but __registered users__

Thanks
Japz
activities.markdown_message:
I see this report #145396 which is also information disclosure issue, but on that report (#145396) , the issue is enumeration of subscribed/unsubscribed users and it is a valid security issue.. then on my report , it is enumeration not only of subscribe users but registered users

Thanks
Japz

activities.message:
There is arguably a difference between a public communication platform (our forum) and a private newsletter subscription.

In the forums it is clearly communicated that you are joining a public community and most people even do use their real life name. In our newsletter the expectation is a little bit different.
activities.markdown_message:
There is arguably a difference between a public communication platform (our forum) and a private newsletter subscription.

In the forums it is clearly communicated that you are joining a public community and most people even do use their real life name. In our newsletter the expectation is a little bit different.

activities.message:
Exactly , you said that in public community most people even use their real life name, with that being said.. my question is, __isn't more important to secure those sensitive information of the registered user ?__ , and also even if it is public community or newsletter.. it is clear in my sample (on my previous comment) that the attacker can use this to perform malicious intent and even compromised the users account of a registered users.

Let me know if it still not a valid security issue, if still not on your side , can we disclose this ? so that other researcher may avoid reporting the same issue.
activities.markdown_message:
Exactly , you said that in public community most people even use their real life name, with that being said.. my question is, isn't more important to secure those sensitive information of the registered user ? , and also even if it is public community or newsletter.. it is clear in my sample (on my previous comment) that the attacker can use this to perform malicious intent and even compromised the users account of a registered users.

Let me know if it still not a valid security issue, if still not on your side , can we disclose this ? so that other researcher may avoid reporting the same issue.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hello nextcloud, i have another findings, i found that email address enumeration and or username enumeration is possible in signup/registration and forgot password under https://help.nextcloud.com/ , email/username enumeration can be use in any malicious intent by a malicious minded user.

  • For registration see attached (signup.JPG)
  • For forgot password, see attached (forgot_password.JPG)

Additional info about username/email enumeration , i found it here: https://www.troyhunt.com/everything-you-ever-wanted-to-know/ under "Username enumeration and the impact on anonymity"
vulnerability_information:
Hello nextcloud, i have another findings, i found that email address enumeration and or username enumeration is possible in signup/registration and forgot password under https://help.nextcloud.com/ , email/username enumeration can be use in any malicious intent by a malicious minded user.

- For registration see attached (signup.JPG)
- For forgot password, see attached (forgot_password.JPG)

Additional info about username/email enumeration , i found it here: https://www.troyhunt.com/everything-you-ever-wanted-to-know/ under "Username enumeration and the impact on anonymity"
